titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I spent the whole morning, or at least the most part of it, in writing to Willie Murray an opinion on a rotten Theosophical book, written by some friend who is bitten with the modern craze for the revived Gnosticism!

p.hi: in his office. He was speaking of

of Exeter, who combined a Stall at Durham with the bishoprick. He said that as a boy in Durham School he could well remember the old man being wheeled in to the daily services during the 3 weeks of his 'close residence', & there slumbering manifestly to the delight of the boys!
